title: Which is better? Learning slowly but you understand the concepts perfectly or learning quickly but having knowledge gaps and holes in understanding? - Quora

response.answer_text: Learning slowly or quickly doesn't matter. What matter is that you understand the concept perfectly and try to apply them in the associated field. It is important that th e intention should be very clear, Needs to be focused. Also it is most important that one needs to acquire the knowledge under a great teacher. If a person is passionate about learning/ study something, then automatically the nature will help to get a right teacher. A great teacher can show you the right path and can help you to achieve that goal. "Arise!! Awake!! Stop Not untill you reach the goal" This is a famous saying by great saint of India "Swamy Vivekanand"   :)

Everyone will give you a different answer depending on what works for their particular situation.  You will be better off deciding this on an individual basis for each learning project. Generally you should be more slow and methodical when learning a subject that has a high lifetime value, meaning learning that info or skill will pay off big over the next however many decades of your life. When the stakes are lower you can afford to have more holes in your knowledge and that will be optimal.  Also factor in your motivation. If slow and methodical kills your drive then don't do it. Most people are unsuccessful because their motivation is weak, not because they are slow learners or low iq.  Being able to learn fast only matters if you are motivated well first.  From iPhone
